nlm_mosaictess

Simulate the NLM introduced in Gaucherel (2008).

nlm_mosaictess(ncol, nrow, resolution = 1, germs, rescale = TRUE)

Arguments

ncol

[numerical(1)] Number of columns for the raster.
nrow

[numerical(1)] Number of rows for the raster.
resolution

[numerical(1)] Resolution of the raster.
germs

[numerical(1)] Intensity parameter (non-negative integer).
rescale

[logical(1)] If TRUE (default), the values are rescaled between 0-1.

Value

RasterLayer

Details

nlm_mosaictess offers the first option of simulating a neutral landscape model described in Gaucherel (2008). It generates a random point pattern (the germs) with an independent distribution and uses the voronoi tessellation to simulate the mosaic landscapes.

References

Gaucherel, C. (2008) Neutral models for polygonal landscapes with linear networks. Ecological Modelling, 219, 39 - 48.

Examples

# simulate polygonal landscapes
(mosaictess <- nlm_mosaictess(ncol = 30, nrow = 60, germs = 200))
#> class       : RasterLayer 
#> dimensions  : 60, 30, 1800  (nrow, ncol, ncell)
#> resolution  : 1, 1  (x, y)
#> extent      : 0, 30, 0, 60  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : NA 
#> data source : in memory
#> names       : layer 
#> values      : 0, 1  (min, max)
#> 


# visualize the NLM
rasterVis::levelplot(mosaictess, margin = FALSE, par.settings = rasterVis::viridisTheme())
